parameters.content:
## 🎯 WORKFLOW PURPOSE
This workflow demonstrates practical Code node usage for:

• **Data filtering & transformation**
• **Statistical calculations**  
• **Formatting for external systems**
• **Real-world business scenarios**

💡 Perfect for learning JavaScript data manipulation in n8n!

Author : **David Olusola**

🚀 **n8n Coaching**
Unlock the full potential of n8n with personalized, one-on-one coaching. Whether you're just getting started or need help solving a specific challenge, I’ll guide you step-by-step so you can build confidently and efficiently.
👉 [Book Coaching Session](mailto:david@daexai.com?subject=n8n%20Coaching%20Request)

 **n8n Consulting**
Have a complex automation project, unique integration needs, or want a custom workflow built from scratch? Let’s collaborate to design and implement a robust solution tailored to your business.
📩 [Inquire About Consulting Services](mailto:david@daexai.com?subject=n8n%20Consultation%20Request)

## 📊 EXAMPLE 1: FILTER & TRANSFORM

**What it does:**
• Filters users over 18 years old
• Adds calculated bonus field (10% of salary)
• Creates formatted email addresses
• Outputs each user as separate item

**Use cases:**
• Lead qualification
• Customer segmentation
• Data enrichment

## 📈 EXAMPLE 2: CALCULATE STATS

**What it does:**
• Aggregates team data into statistics
• Calculates averages, totals, distributions
• Creates single summary object

**Use cases:**
• Dashboard data preparation
• Report generation
• KPI calculations
• Business intelligence

## 🔄 EXAMPLE 3: FORMAT FOR EXPORT

**What it does:**
• Formats data for multiple output types
• Creates CSV, email lists, API payloads
• Adds metadata and timestamps

**Use cases:**
• API integrations
• Email marketing prep
• Data export functions
• Multi-format reporting

## 🚀 QUICK START GUIDE

**1. Click "Test workflow" to run**
**2. Check each Code node's output**
**3. Edit JavaScript code to experiment**
**4. Copy patterns for your own workflows**

**Pro Tips:**
• Use `console.log()` for debugging
• Test with small datasets first
• Always handle edge cases
• Return proper n8n format

_metadata.name: Learn JavaScript Data Processing with Code Node: Filtering, Analysis & Export Examples
